later time (RR=0.61, 95% CI 0.15 to 2.53) (3). However, when results of two cohort studies 
were pooled (8,12), there was a significant increase in the risk of neonatal readmissions if 
discharge occurred within 24 hours of birth (RR=1.20, 95% CI 1.11 to 1.30). 
Neonatal jaundice, dehydration and signs of congenital gastrointestinal and cardiac 
defects were the most common reasons for the excess neonatal readmissions. The overall 
quality of evidence was graded as low.
